metadata.name: God of Fire #1/15
metadata.description:
God of Fire also known as Kandaran Kelan Theyyam in Traditional words in Kerala, India. 
Theyyam is a performing art ritual conducted in families/ family temples in the northern part of Kerala, India and has originated about 1500 years ago. The art form involves fierce make up, head gear and fire during performance and is considered as a form of worship to the particular deity of the temple/ the main god of the tribe/ family that follows the same.  
In this Kandaran Kelan Theyyam, the artists wear makeup, headgear and dance according to the rhythm of drums and cymbals. The final act happens, when the artist jumps several times through the pyre of fire and transforms into demi god and blesses the devotees.  
I have captured this image in March 2022 at Kannur, Kerala.

Artist: Shreenivas Yenni  
Medium: Photography  
Edition: 15  
Location: Kannur, Kerala, India  
Camera used: Fujifilm XT-3  
Year: 2022  
Dimensions: 6000 X 4000

License: Primary NFT holder is free to use in advertising, display privately and in groups, including virtual galleries, documentaries and essays by holder of the NFT, as long as creator is credited. Provides no rights to create commercial merchandise, commercial distribution, or derivative works. Copyright remains with creator. This still image will be minted only once as an edition of 15/15 NFT artwork on the Etherium Blockchain, and no other editions or 1/1 will be produced on this or any other blockchain.
